children.name: DOCTOR ROBERT
children.insight_short: DECCA REJECTING THE BEATLES - GREATEST MISTAKE OF ALL TIME?
children.insight_full: The post composed +50% more likes and +70% more comments than average, the high amount of comments is a result of the discussion of whether Decca made a mistake rejecting the Beatles after their New Year’s Day audition in 1962. The positive comments claim that the Beatles never would have been as big of a success without George Martin who ended up signing them to EMI’s Parlophone label. The negativt comments consist mainly of people accusing Decca of making the greatest mistake in history. Neutral comments were a mix of relevant comments related to the post, and other less relevant comments of spam-character.
insight_pos: The positive comments claim that the Beatles never would have been as big of a success without George Martin who ended up signing them to EMI’s Parlophone label
insight_neg: The negativt comments consist mainly of people accusing Decca of making the greatest mistake in history
insight_neu: Neutral comments were a mix of relevant comments related to the post, and other less relevant comments of spam-character.
insight_eng: The post composed +50% more likes and +70% more comments than average, the high amount of comments is a result of the discussion of whether Decca made a mistake rejecting the Beatles after their New Year’s Day audition in 1962
insight_quote: George Martin is the fifth member of the Beatles!
I would never trust Decca with anything after the 1962-fiasko

children.insight_full: The post composed +50% more likes and +70% more comments than average, the high amount of comments is a result of the discussion of whether Decca made a mistake rejecting the Beatles after their New Year’s Day audition in 1962. The positive comments claim that the Beatles never would have been as big of a success without George Martin who ended up signing them to EMI’s Parlophone label. The negativt comments consist mainly of people accusing Decca of making the greatest mistake in history. Neutral comments were a mix of relevant comments related to the post, and other less relevant comments of spam-character.
insight_pos: The positive comments claim that the Beatles never would have been as big of a success without George Martin who ended up signing them to EMI’s Parlophone label
insight_neg: The negativt comments consist mainly of people accusing Decca of making the greatest mistake in history
insight_neu: Neutral comments were a mix of relevant comments related to the post, and other less relevant comments of spam-character.
insight_eng: The post composed +50% more likes and +70% more comments than average, the high amount of comments is a result of the discussion of whether Decca made a mistake rejecting the Beatles after their New Year’s Day audition in 1962
insight_quote: George Martin is the fifth member of the Beatles!
I would never trust Decca with anything after the 1962-fiasko
